results.title: In song and dance
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Don Saunders, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions
results.brief_description: The preparations and some scenes of the 1964 Northern Territory Eisteddfod held at Darwin. Local townspeople are joined by cattlemen and First Nations people from far out stations, and get together to produce an eisteddfod unlike any other - with items of all kinds, from classical ballet to First Nations peoples’ music and dance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Don Saunders, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions

results.title: In signal honour: 1865-1965, 100 years of telecommunications
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate the centenary (1865-1965) of the International Telecommunications Union, this film traces the development of telecommunications during the last hundred years, showing the emergence and impact of telephone, radio, television and apace communications. Highlights include international television transmissions.

results.title: In sickness and in health. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
This film uses resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory to show aspects of anatomy and physiology. This film in the series shows the body’s enemies and how the body defends itself.

results.title: In search of the bowhead whale
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a whaling expedition that included Scott McVay, an authority on whales, and filmmaker Bill Mason. The objective was to find and film the bowhead, a magnificent inhabitant of the cold Arctic seas brought to the edge of extinction by excessive commercial whaling. With helicopter and Inuit guide, aqualungs and underwater cameras, the expedition searches out and meets the bowhead and beluga. (Six awards, including New York; Columbus)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Mason, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: In search of home
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A film on child adoption describing how a welfare agency seeks to find the right home for each child placed under its care. How the agency goes about selecting good “parent material” is seen as two childless couples apply for adoption of a child. The first couple demonstrates the type of parental qualities looked for; in the case of the second, there is reason to doubt their ability to provide a healthy emotional environment for an adopted child. We see, too, the need for patient understanding of the delays and complications of placing the right child in the right home.

results.title: In search of balance
results.creator_credit: Anthony T Lorch and National Recreation and Park Association
results.brief_description: A film to make communities aware of the value and need for recreation and park services. Illustrates passive and active recreation, solitary and group interaction and structured and unstructured activities. Also reveals the many concerns of environmentalists and conservationists and traces the origin of recreation as we know it today.

results.title: In praise of retirement
results.creator_credit: Harley Jones and Newport College of Art & Design (Film School)
results.brief_description: The film gives a portrait of one retired man who has succeeded in keeping active and aware of outside interests. His story is presented along-side an explanation of pre-retirement courses for men in industry, organised by the Newport and Monmouthshire Retirement Council.

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.
